item.title: QGIS - Creating new column from existing using Python
item.author: arun@arunmozhi.in (Arunmozhi)
item.description: Yesterday, I was working on the ward level parks map of Chennai I had to join a CSV data layer with the boundary polygon layer, but there was one issue while my CSV file has the ward numbers as integers (1,2,3..etc), the polygon layer had them as strings (Ward 1, Ward 2, Ward 3 …etc.,) So I was thinking, wouldn’t it be nice just to strip the word Ward and put it in a new column, so that I can make a join by matching the ward numbers. Turns out Python integration in QGIS is so good that, I did it without even searching the internet. Here is how.
